title: Strictly Come Dancing's Kevin Clifton missing from pro line-up tour
text:
King Kevin won’t be going on the Strictly tour (Picture: Rex, PA)

Strictly Come Dancing‘s professional tour line-up has been announced – although there seems to be a few familiar faces missing.

King Kevin Clifton, 37, appears to be absent from the line-up, which will definitely leave many Strictly fans disappointed.

However, Kevin’s estranged wife Karen, who is still his performing partner on their own tours, is going off on the dates without him.

Other big names missing from the tour is AJ Pritchard, Aljaž Škorjanec, Anton Du Beke, Amy Dowden Giovanni Pernice, and Janette Manrara.

It is Metro.co.uk’s understanding that not all the professional dancers from the BBC show feature in the tour and that it’s down to their availability.

A post on the official site reads: ‘Dust off your dancing shoes!…

Kevin Clifton with girlfriend Stacey Dooley (Picture: BBC)

‘Fans up and down the UK will be thrilled to learn the line-up of dancers who will be bringing all the glitz and glamour to the live stage in the brand new 2020 Professionals Tour. Tickets are on sale now.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Cha-cha-cha-ing their way around the UK will be no less than 10 of the incredibly popular and multi-award-winning professional dancers from 2019 Strictly Come Dancing BBC One series, in what promises to be another explosion of electrifying dance.’

Kevin and Karen may not be on the pro tour together after their split, but another estranged couple is hitting the road together – Neil and Katya Jones.

Seann Walsh and Katya Jones (Picture: Ray Burmiston)

The couple’s marriage broke down earlier this year, just months after Katya was caught on camera snogging her dance partner Seann Walsh.

Another fan favourite hitting the road is Dianne Buswell, who was voted off the show last weekend along with partner Dev Griffin.

Other dancers in the line-up include Nadiya Bychkova, Graziano Di Prima, Oti Mabuse, Gorka Marquez, Luba Mushtuk and Johannes Radebe.

The tour features a gruelling schedule of 34 dates across the country, with many days featuring an evening performance and a matinee.

The shows kick off on May 7, 2020 at The Lowry in Salford, and will head to cities including London, Nottingham, Sheffield and Birmingham before ending in Edinburgh on June 4.

BBC and Kevin Clifton’s representatives have been approached for a comment.

description: Strictly Come Dancing star Kevin Clifton missing from tour as pro line-up is announced.
